m_szDocTitle: Tesla's Model X Pushed Back 1 Year, Now Due In Late 2014 | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: March 12th, 2013 by James Ayre   Tesla Motors has pushed back the release date for its next electric SUV, the Model X. Originally slated for release in early 2014, the vehicle is now scheduled for release in late 2014. According to Tesla, the reason for pushing back the date is so that it can continue focusing on the very well received Model S. Tesla Model X Image Credit: NRMA New Cars In a statement on the matter, Tesla said : “Tesla has been intensely focused on Model S, its production and product enhancements and believe there is increased volume potential for Model S.
